@198GODFATHER
You are incorrect. Actual picture resolution is 1920x816 (apparently without interlacing) which, due to the weird way HD resolutions are labelled, means it counts as 1080p.

To determine if a picture is 1080p, look to the horizontal resolution. If it's 1920, then it's technically a 1080p image. If it's 1280, then it's a 720p image.

All of these comments assume that we're talking about non-interlaced (progressive) images.

Good One!
